Question: As with the residential projects for Adler & Sullivan, this person designed his bootleg houses on his own time.
Hints: In his earlier days, this person worked with some of the top architects of the Chicago School, including Sullivan.
Though most famous as an architect, this person was an active dealer in Japanese art, primarily ukiyo-e woodblock prints.
This person first traveled to Japan in 1905, where he bought hundreds of prints.
